p: where Y is the seedling height on a given date; a, the final height at the end of the second growing season (asymptote of the curve); b, the date at which half of the final height is attained (the point of inflection of the curve); c, the component of the growth rate; e, the base of the natural logarithm; u, the random effect of block and; ğœ€, the residual error. The date of the final height corresponds to the date of growth cessation and is commonly used as an estimate of bud formation.
